text.text: What indicators confirm that a claim has been successfully submitted?

text: The following indicators may confirm that a claim has been successfully submitted:

text.text:
User message:
Describe the various methods for confirming claim submission in ZOLL Billing.

text: When ZOLL Billing sends claims to the clearinghouse during its nightly submission, it gathers all the claims that are ready to go and puts them in a group or batch. You can find which batch a particular claim is in by going to the Claim page and clicking the "Audit trail" tab. For the date the claim was submitted, you will see an entry under the Details column that says "Submitted to clearinghouse batch #XXXXXX, file XXXXXXX. Another way to see the batch information is to hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click Claim Batches.

text.text: What details are provided in the Submission History tab of a claim?

text: The Submission History tab on the claim page shows the actual printable PDF. The Audit Trail and Billing Lifecycle also reflect the submission.

text.text: Where can users find information about claim batches?

text: Users can find information about claim batches by going to the Claim Batches page. This page lists all the claim batches that have been submitted, including the batch number, submission status, submission date, claim count, and batch filename. Users can also find information about claim batches by clicking the "Audit trail" tab on the Claim page.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing assist users in tracking claim submission progress?

text: ZOLL Billing automatically updates the claim status from Submitted to Follow-up - Un-adjudicated after 30 days.

text.text: Can users manually verify claim submission status in ZOLL Billing?

text: Yes, users can manually verify claim submission status by clicking Verify receipt. If the verification was a mistake, users can click the "x" next to "Verify manually" and the line will change back to "Verify receipt".

text.text: What is the significance of the Batch# in ZOLL Billing's claim submission process?

text: When ZOLL Billing sends claims to the clearinghouse during its nightly submission, it gathers all the claims that are ready to go and puts them in a group or batch. The batch number is a unique identifier for each batch of claims. Users can find information about claim batches by going to the Claim Batches page. This page lists all the claim batches that have been submitted, including the batch number, submission status, submission date, claim count, and batch filename. Users can also find information about claim batches by clicking the "Audit trail" tab on the Claim page.

text.text: Are there any automated notifications for claim submission in ZOLL Billing?

text: When there are important messages that we want you to be aware of, a notification icon will display next to the Help link on every page. You can click the envelope icon to view messages concerning issues that caused a claim you submitted to fail validation. After viewing the notification, you can mark the notification as "Read". Marking messages as "Read" will not delete the message. It will still display in the Notifications window and will still be counted in.

text.text: What does it mean to queue a claim for submission?

text: When a claim is queued for submission, it is scheduled to go to the clearinghouse via the nightly batch submission.
